intro: Randia hoaensis, commonly known as the Hawaiian randia, is a flowering plant native to the Hawaiian Islands. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes many tropical plants. The plant produces small, white to pinkish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a slightly serrated edge. Randia hoaensis is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and is often found in moist, shaded areas of the forest.
